title: (x) Fat straight-sided sans with ink traps - Neil Bold {Paul Hunt}
content:
Any help on this ID would be nice.

Oystein

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/formtre_5994.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Chanel Logo - custom, alt Sackers Gothic {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28794 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Vote or Die" narrow college slab - Flyer Font Straight {Skylar Fein} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28782 "Go to next forum topic")
author: oystein

comments.content:
Yes, it looks Neil Bold, not sure if it is digitized.  
There is a really close one (actually based on Neil Bold) called  
 [Mobley](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-mobley.htm) from Sudtipos, you can see the difference for example in the “E”, and I think that Mobley is a little more “condensed”.

Yes, this IS Neil Bold. Mobley, which is based on this design, is quite a bit different. Here’s the original:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NeilBoldPDH01_5336.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NeilBoldPDH02_3750.gif)

Sorry about the tune Paul, but I had it all written down before I saw your answer and once I saw it, I just changed the beginning instead of “It looks Neil...”.  
Call me lazy.

Thanks everyone.

Paul: Is it possible to get a digitized version?

hmmmm. Mobley is the closest that I know of. I’m not sure if there are any outstanding copyright issues. I’ll have to do some research. What are you wanting to use this for?  
aha! apparently there IS a digital version out there:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/9314](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411234035/http:/typophile.com/node/9314 "http://typophile.com/node/9314")

Splendid!

Thanks again Paul. I checked on the Castcraft Software site, but could not find the font in one of their four designer collections, but they might have more fonts than the ones displayed on their site. The site seames a little outdated. I’ll try an email (even though Mike Yanega implied in the previous post that their customer service is a little outdated as well).

Oystein
